sentences.sContent: The thicker lava would have taken two weeks to solidify.
sentences.sCn: 更厚的熔岩需要两周才会凝固。

sentences.sContent: The Energy Department plans to solidify the deadly waste in a high-tech billion-dollar factory.
sentences.sCn: 能源部计划在一家斥资10亿美元的高科技工厂里凝固这些致命的废物。

words.tran: 固体的；可靠的；立体的；结实的；一致的
坚固地；坚硬地；团结一致地
凝固，团结（solidify的过去式和过去分词形式）
使凝固（solidify的ing形式）；使团结；使充实

trans.tranOther: When a liquid solidifies or is solidified, it changes into a solid
